elements.title: orange chocolate chip lichen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the orange chocolate chip lichen (pictured) was given its common name because of its fruitbodies that look like chocolate?

elements.title: Carol Wilson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Carol Wilson had to pretend that she was a schoolteacher when unofficially representing England at the 1971 Women's World Cup?

elements.title: Deveselu Military Base (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Aegis BMD at Deveselu Military Base, intended to intercept missiles from Iran, has been called a "direct threat" by Russian officials?

elements.title: Eyabi Okie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Michigan defensive end Eyabi Okie, ranked number 3 in the 2018 college football recruiting class, changed his surname from "Anoma" to recognize his mother who lives in Africa?

elements.title: Declaration of Sainte-Adresse (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in the 1916 Declaration of Sainte-Adresse Britain, France and Russia committed to securing the political and economic independence of Belgium after the First World War?

elements.title: Ausma Malik (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ausma Malik is the first hijab-wearing Muslim woman to be elected to public office in Canada?

elements.title: Bejeweled (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the music video for Taylor Swift's song "Bejeweled" hints that her 2010 album Speak Now would be her next re-recording?

elements.title: Algonquin Hotel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Algonquin Hotel keeps a cat in its lobby?
